DataElement.preferredName: Personal Medical History Use Any Other Drug To Obtain High Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An indicator related to the history of other drugs to get high.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Personal Medical History Use Any Other Drug To Obtain High
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies._A question about whether an individual uses or used any other drug._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._To come into possession of something._An elevated level or position or degree; greater than normal in degree or intensity or amount.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Personal Medical History Use Any Other Drug
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.:A question about whether an individual uses or used any other drug.

Concepts.definition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.
A question about whether an individual uses or used any other drug.

Property.preferredDefinition: Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.:To come into possession of something.:An elevated level or position or degree; greater than normal in degree or intensity or amount.

Concepts.definition: Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
To come into possession of something.
An elevated level or position or degree; greater than normal in degree or intensity or amount.

ConceptualDomain.preferredName: Chronic or Associated Diseases and Exposures
ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: chronic diseases, as well as diseases and exposures associated with cancer.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
